definition: to patrol
to patrol/to make one's rounds/classifier for rounds of drinks
see 山查[shan1 zha1]
surname Zha
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)

sentences.english: Uncle Jim took the air rifle and went on a recce to the far end of the quarry.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆叔叔拿起氣槍一路巡查到採石場的最遠處。

sentences.english: Enemies include walking, exploding bowls of custard and force-fed , exploding rabbits.
sentences.chinese: 你的敵人包括滾動的果凍爆炸球和巡查軍隊，爆炸兔。

sentences.english: Two police officers have the class take turns on duty, a 24-hour inspections.
sentences.chinese: 幹警們每班兩人輪流值勤，實行24小時不間斷巡查。

sentences.english: In the northern port city of Alexandria, some residents were unnerved by the young men on patrol.
sentences.chinese: 亞歷山大的北港，一些居民被巡查的年輕人們嚇壞了。

sentences.english: Blade wheel was belligerent passengers by the Japanese patrolled boat hit.
sentences.chinese: 刀鋒所乘客輪被尋釁的日軍巡查艇擊中。
